ðŸŽ“ Hunt-to-Rule Graduation Criteria

Active hunt hypotheses are promoted to permanent detection rules when they meet ALL of the following:

  1. Minimum True Positives: â‰¥ 3 confirmed true positives across different client environments
  2. False Positive Rate: < 5% over a 30-day observation window
  3. MITRE Mapping: Technique must be mapped to a validated ATT&CK technique
  4. Query Stability: Hunt query must execute successfully for 14+ consecutive days without modification
  5. Peer Review: Reviewed and approved by a Senior Hunt Lead
  6. Client Coverage: Successfully tested against â‰¥ 2 client environments (SOCaaS)
Rules that graduate are auto-deployed to all applicable client SIEMs via the SIEM Push pipeline.

Decision Matrix
Network Isolation Criteria
✅ Active C2 beaconing detected
✅ Ransomware binary executed
✅ Lateral movement from host
⚠️ Encryption in progress
⚠️ Credential dumping activity
Account Disable Criteria
✅ Account used for lateral movement
✅ Credentials in attacker hands (confirmed)
✅ Unusual logon patterns post-incident
⚠️ Service account with unusual auth
⚠️ DA/EA accounts â€” immediate escalation
⚠️ Eradication must only begin after full scope is confirmed. Phase 4 (Investigate) still in progress.

📊 Executive Summary (1-2 page non-technical brief)
On 28 February 2026, NagaWorld Ltd. experienced a ransomware attack attributed to the ALPHV/BlackCat threat actor group. The attack originated via a targeted spear-phishing email and resulted in the encryption of files across 847 endpoints. DACTA's MDR team detected the incident and activated War Room WR-2026-003 within 28 minutes of ransomware deployment. Containment actions isolated 23 high-risk systems within 45 minutes. Investigation is ongoing; recovery timeline estimated at 36-48 hours.

Detailed forensic analysis, kill chain reconstruction, MITRE mapping, and remediation evidence. Auto-populates from investigation data.
📋 IOC Export
Export 47 IOCs for blocking, sharing, and threat intelligence integration.
💡 Lessons Learned
Post-incident analysis to be completed within 5 business days.

What is T1053.005?
🤖
DACTA Copilot 14:36:49 SGT Â· 0.9s MITRE ATT&CK
Technique found in the MITRE ATT&CK knowledge base. This technique is relevant to the current investigation context â€” commonly used by LockBit 3.0 for persistence.
T1053.005
Scheduled Task / Job: Scheduled Task
Persistence Execution Privilege Escalation
ATT&CK v14
Sub-technique of T1053
Medium Prevalence
Adversaries may abuse the Windows Task Scheduler to perform task scheduling for initial or recurring execution of malicious code. There are multiple ways to access the Task Scheduler in Windows: schtasks /create, the Task Scheduler GUI (taskschd.msc), or Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI). Scheduled tasks can also be set to execute code remotely from a UNC path.
🔍 Detection Methods
  • Monitor for schtasks.exe creation with unusual parameters or parent processes
  • Windows Event IDs 4698, 4699, 4700, 4701, 4702 (scheduled task lifecycle events)
  • Monitor \Windows\System32\Tasks\ directory for unexpected XML files
  • Look for tasks with encoded payloads or PowerShell download cradles
Related: T1053 T1547.001 T1569.002 T1059.001
